T1098: Adversaries may manipulate accounts to maintain and/or elevate access to victim systems
T1098.001: Adversaries may add adversary-controlled credentials to a cloud account to maintain persistent access to victim accounts and instances within the environment
T1098.002: Adversaries may grant additional permission levels to maintain persistent access to an adversary-controlled email account
T1098.003: An adversary may add additional roles or permissions to an adversary-controlled cloud account to maintain persistent access to a tenant
T1098.004: Adversaries may modify the SSH authorized_keys file to maintain persistence on a victim host
T1098.005: Adversaries may register a device to an adversary-controlled account
T1098.006: An adversary may add additional roles or permissions to an adversary-controlled user or service account to maintain persistent access to a container orchestration system
T1197: Adversaries may abuse BITS jobs to persistently execute code and perform various background tasks
T1547: Adversaries may configure system settings to automatically execute a program during system boot or logon to maintain persistence or gain higher-level privileges on compromised systems
T1547.001: Adversaries may achieve persistence by adding a program to a startup folder or referencing it with a Registry run key
T1547.002: Adversaries may abuse authentication packages to execute DLLs when the system boots
T1547.003: Adversaries may abuse time providers to execute DLLs when the system boots
T1547.004: Adversaries may abuse features of Winlogon to execute DLLs and/or executables when a user logs in
T1547.005: Adversaries may abuse security support providers (SSPs) to execute DLLs when the system boots
T1547.006: Adversaries may modify the kernel to automatically execute programs on system boot
T1547.007: Adversaries may modify plist files to automatically run an application when a user logs in
T1547.008: Adversaries may modify or add LSASS drivers to obtain persistence on compromised systems
T1547.009: Adversaries may create or modify shortcuts that can execute a program during system boot or user login
T1547.010: Adversaries may use port monitors to run an adversary supplied DLL during system boot for persistence or privilege escalation
T1547.012: Adversaries may abuse print processors to run malicious DLLs during system boot for persistence and/or privilege escalation
